propex package documentation¶

Submodules¶

propex.fasta module¶

The FASTA module contains classes for accessing FASTA files and FASTA index files.

class propex.fasta.Fasta(fname)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represent a FASTA file.

generate_records()[source]¶

FastaRecord generator.

Returns:a FastaRecord generator.
get_record(key)[source]¶

Get a single FASTA record.

Parameters:key – an integer.
Returns:the FastaRecord stored at key.
class propex.fasta.FastaIndex(fname)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents an index for a FASTA file.

Parameters:fname – filename of the FASTA file.
create_index()[source]¶

Generate a FASTA index from a FASTA file.

This function assumes that the fasta index filename in the constructor has a corresponding FASTA file without the ”.fai” (or any other) extension.

Returns:see parse_index
Raises:ValueError if the FASTA file contains duplicate headers or if the FASTA file has sequence entries where lines have different lengths (not counting the last line of the sequence).
keys()[source]¶
parse_index()[source]¶

Parse a FASTA index file to match the format of samtools faidx.

Returns:an OrderedDict with sequence names (headers) as keys and dicts as values. The value dicts have the following members:

name: the sequence name (FASTA header line) length: sequence length offset: the byte offset of the first base of the sequence nbase: number of bases per line of sequence linelen: number of bytes per line of sequence
Raises:ValueError if the file cannot be parsed, if the file contains duplicated headers or if the file is empty.
class propex.fasta.FastaRecord(seq, header)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represent a FASTA record.

Parameters:seq – the sequence of the record represented either as a string or as a Sequence object.
Raises:TypeError if the seq argument is not a string or a Sequence.

propex.genbank module¶

Classes for dealing with GenBank files.

class propex.genbank.GenBank(fname)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represent a GenBank file.

Class attributes:
  • filename: the filename of the GenBank file.
  • index: a list of dictionaries representing an index of the file.
Parameters:fname – filename of the GenBank file.
features = ['CDS']¶

List of supported features.

features_at_location(location, locus=None)[source]¶

Get features at a location.

Parameters:
  • location – a Location object.
  • locus – a locus name. Ignored if it is None.
Returns:

a list of GenBankFeature objects. If locus is not None, only features in that locus are returned, otherwise all loci are searched. Returns an empty list if there are no features overlapping the location.
get_locus(index)[source]¶

Get a specific GenBankLocus object.

Parameters:index – the index of the wanted locus in the index.
Returns:a GenBankLocus object.
class propex.genbank.GenBankFeature(feature_type, location, qualifiers=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represent a GenBank feature.

Class attributes
  • feature_type: a string with the feature key.
  • location: a Location object representing the lcoation of the feature.
  • qualifiers: a dictionary of qualifiers of the feature.
Parameters:
  • feature_type – name of the feature.
  • location – a Location object.
  • qualifiers – a dictionary of qualifiers with the qualifier names as keys and the qualifier values as values.
classmethod from_string(feature_string)[source]¶

Create a GenBankFeature instance from a string.

Parameters:feature_string – a string representing a GenBank feature.
Returns:a GenBankFeature object.
get_qualifier(qualifier_name)[source]¶

Get a feature qualifier.

Parameters:qualifier_name – a string representing a qualifier.
Returns:the value of the qualifier.
Raises:KeyError if the feature does not have a qualifier called qualifier_name.
class propex.genbank.GenBankLocus(name, seq, features=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A simple class representing a GenBank locus.

Class attributes:
  • name: locus name.
  • seq: a Sequence object with the sequence of the locus.
Parameters:
  • name – the name of the locus.
  • seq – a Sequence object representing the sequence of the locus.
class propex.genbank.Location(locstring)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represent a GenBank feature location.

For more information on locations, see http://www.insdc.org/files/feature_table.html#3.4

As of now, not all types of locations are implemented. Those that are implemented are single bases, ranges, ranges with unknown lower bound, ranges with unknown upper bound and locations where the exact position is unknown, but it is one of the bases between two positions.

Class attributes:

  • locstring: the string representation of the location.

  • loctype: the type of the location.

  • start: the start position (including).

  • stop: the stop position (including).

  • is_complement: boolean indicating whether the position represents

    the complement of the sequence.

Parameters:locstring – a GenBanke location string.
loc_complement = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object>¶

Regular expression for finding complement locations.

loc_lower_unknown = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object>¶

Regular expression for locations with unknown lower boundary.

loc_one_of = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object>¶

Regular expression for single base locations within a range.

loc_range = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object>¶

Regular expression for range locations,

loc_single = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object>¶

Regular expression for single base locations.

loc_upper_unknown = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object>¶

Regular expression for locations with unknown upper boundary.

overlaps(location)[source]¶

Test whether the location overlaps with another location.

Parameters:location – a Location object.
Returns:True if the locations overlap with at least one base, otherwise False.

propex.sequence module¶

Classes and functions for representing DNA sequences.

class propex.sequence.Sequence(seq)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represent a DNA sequence.

Parameters:seq – a string representing a DNA sequence. Bases A, C, G, T and N are allowed.
Raises:ValuError if the sequence contains illegal characters.
revcomp()[source]¶

Get the reverse complement of the sequence.

Returns:a sequence object representing the reverse complement of the sequence.
